column4: so we can presume 2.6.24-18 worked for you ? *-19 is the one that fails?
then boot with the livecd and chroot to the ubuntu installation on the hd and do "sudo apt-get install linux-image-2.6.24-18-generic"
https://help.ubuntu.com/community/RecoveringUbuntuAfterInstallingWindows <<< here under "Overwriting the Windows bootloader" there are instructions on how to chroot to the hd installation
instead of this command "sudo grub-install --root-directory=/mnt/root /dev/hda" you have to "sudo apt-get  install linux-image-2.6.24-18-generic"
I have to sudo grub after ou before your first advaise?
read only the part under "Overwriting the Windows bootloader" section and ignore grub commands
once you have the ubuntu partition mounted on /mnt/root do "chroot /mnt/root/" and issue the "apt-get install linux-image-2.6.24-18-generic" command
have you mounted the ubuntu partition ?
yes I try to update apt source.list but it seems it can connect to the archive server
you do not have net connection from the livecd?
i can use internet by live cd but not with chroot
then try something just dl the deb package from packages.ubuntu.com and copy it to somewere in /mnt/root/ (/mnt/root/root for example) then use "dpkg -i root/file.deb"
you can dl the package from here http://packages.ubuntu.com/hardy/linux-image-2.6.24-18-generic
